para.text: Version 5.1
Added support for the groundwater transport (GWT) process in MODFLOW 6.
Added support for MODFLOW 6 Time Series files.
The Edit Data Sets and Show/Hide Objects dialog boxes retain their positions, size, and the expanded status of their nodes after closing and reopening.
Changing the MT3D times in the MODFLOW Time dialog box causes those times to also be change in the MT3D boundaries.
An "Ignore this" option has been added to the pop-up menu in the Errors and Warnings dialog box.
Added an option to plot PEST direct observations, prior information, or both in the Data Visualization dialog box.
The line thicknesses of vectors can now be specified.
ModelMuse can now import interim residual files generated by PEST.
It is not possible to undo importing, editing hiding, or displaying an image.
The points used to geolocate an image can now have an associated ID.
When importing or editing an image, the user can now specify the coordinates and an ID for each point without first specifying the pixel location of the points.
The user can now import some types of MODFLOW 6 observations in the "Import Points" dialog box.
ModelMuse can now import the flow data from models that have multiple packages of the same type.
ModelMuse can now import simulated values directly from the Observation Extractor utility program output files.
When importing Shapefiles, it is now possible to use the label of a CSV attribute to indicate the data represent real numbers, integers, Booleans, or text.
Instead of activating or deactivating PEST, there is now a third option to allow users to define calibration observations but without activating PEST.
Added support for the SAVE SATURATION option in the NPF package.:
ModelMonitor now displays budgets for MODFLOW 6 advanced packages.
After running a MODFLOW 6 file, the mfsim.lst file is displayed in addition to the model .lst file.
Made changes throughout ModelMuse to account for a change in TJvImageComboBox.
Changed the export of SUTRA template files for PEST.
ModelMuse now prevents the user from exporting a model with a period in the file name root if PEST is activated.
PLPROC Krigging is now only used when the PLPROC executable is found.
Fixed a bug that could cause an access violation when importing the Recharge, EVT, or ETS packages in an existing MODFLOW model.
ModelMuse no longer identifies the formula for the IDOMAIN data set as invalid when creating a new model with no grid.
Fixed running PEST on computers in which the decimal separator is not a period.
Fixed a bug that could cause access violations when editing Lakes in MODFLOW 6 models.
In the MODFLOW 6 lake package if the bottom of a lake cell with a horizontal connection is above the top of the lake cell, the lake cell bottom is reduced to be equal to the lake cell top.
The text on the MODFLOW Name package checkboxes now reflects the flow and solver packages in MODFLOW 6 for MODFLOW 6 models.
Fixed bug in displaying cross section data in MODFLOW 6 models.
If no grid has been defined in a structured grid model attempting to restore the default 2D view results in nothing happening instead of generating an error.
Fixed bug that could cause an error when adding or removing PEST observations groups.
Fixed bug that could sometimes cause interior edges of SUTRA meshes to be treated like the edge of the mesh.

ModelMuse now only exports the UNSAT_ETWC or UNSAT_ETAE options in the MODFLOW 6 UZF package if evapotranspiration is simulated. In addition, the ET rate in the MODFLOW 6 UZF package is automatically set to zero if evapotranspiration is not simulated.
Fixed export of prior-information groups in PEST.
Fixed bug in export of PEST prior information equations and prior information groups that resulted in invalid PEST control files.

Fixed bug in export of PEST prior information equations and prior information groups that caused an access violation if the model input was exported more than once after opening the model in ModelMuse.
Fixed bug in specifying yields in the MT3D-USGS reaction package.
Fixed bug that could cause access violations due to deleted parameters.
Fixed bug that could cause access violations when evaluating the Ky and Kz data sets in MODFLOW 6 models when anisotropy was used.
Fixed bug in changing the number of times specified for MAW wells.
Fixed drawing objects when they are first being created.
Fixed drawing grid when the active data set is changed.
Fixed bug that caused unneeded pilot points to be defined in PEST.
Fixed bug in evaluating ActiveOnLayer function that could lead to circular dependencies.
When extracting simulated values for observation times before the first simulated time, the value for the first simulated time is now used by Mf6ObsExtractor and SutraObsExtractor.
Fixed bug in editing SFT head water concentrations.
The batch files for creating covariance files for PEST now enclose the commands in quotation marks so that the programs will run even if the paths contain spaces.
Fixed bug that could cause ModelMuse to encounter an an error when drawing contours.
Fixed bug in specifing MVR receivers.
Changed calculation of connlen in the MODFLOW 6 lake package.
Fixed bug that could cause some PEST parameters to not be written to the PVAL file when needed.
Fixed bug in assigning PEST Concentration methods when MT3D but not GWT is selected.
ModelMuse no longer exports head observations that are outside the grid to ModelMate.
Fixed bug in writing PEST prior information equations.
Fixed bug in editing objects specifying MVR boundaries.
